pullrequest.title: Remaining bits relevant to FITS support: PlotWindow, projections, coordinates, etc.

description:
This is the last major FITS-related PR. I don't have any other features to add to it, but I am open to other ways of achieving the objectives I had for it.

1) Some more flexibility for `window_size` argument to PlotWindow (set the size in both dims), and the `aspect` argument. I found that I had to do both of these to make plots where the "velocity" axis has values along its axis much larger than the other two axes. I am open to other suggestions on how to achieve this. The defaults for PlotWindow should be the same.  
2) Added the style option "sum" to the on-axis projections, which basically does the same thing as integrate except that it is a straight summation along the axis instead of multiplying along the path length. Probably only makes sense for uniformly gridded data.   
3) Added ways for PlotWindow to take axes and unit names from the coordinate handler, if they are specified.  An example of this is in the new `PPVCoordinateHandler`. The objective is to get the non-length names and units to show up on the axes by default.   
4) Added the `mul_symbol="dot"` to the `latex_representation`, to get better looking units on projection plots. Also open to other suggestions.   
5) A function to create cut regions from ds9 regions. This one is my favorite.    
6) Using wcsaxes to hijack PlotWindow plots and put celestial coordinates on them.   
7) Some documentation for these features.   

Examples:

http://nbviewer.ipython.org/url/jzuhone.com/files/fits_xray_images.ipynb?create=1

http://nbviewer.ipython.org/url/jzuhone.com/files/fits_radio_cubes.ipynb?create=1
